Launching Fitify - Fitness for People Who Hate Fitness

Micro-workouts disguised as normal life. No spandex required.

February 5, 2026

We just launched Fitify, and honestly, I‚Äôm already tired from clicking the deploy button. üõãÔ∏è

It‚Äôs a fitness app for people who think ‚Äúfitness app‚Äù sounds exhausting. Which‚Ä¶ fair.

The Concept

Micro-workouts disguised as normal life. No gym. No spandex. No one yelling at you about your macros.

The idea is simple: you‚Äôre already doing stuff throughout your day. Walking to the mailbox. Doing dishes. Waiting for coffee to brew. What if all that stuff secretly counted as exercise?

Turns out it does. We just wrote it down and made it slightly more intentional.

Some Example Tips

We grabbed some random ones. They might not even be our favourites! (We have 139 of them ‚Äî we‚Äôre not about to play favourites like some fitness influencer picking their ‚Äútop 5 abs exercises.‚Äù)

üêï The Guilt-Free Dog Walk
Your dog's been staring at you for 20 minutes. Take the hint. Secret: 15-20 min of cardio. Shhh.
üßΩ The Dish Disco
Put on a playlist while doing dishes. You'll move. It's inevitable. Secret: Stealth arm workout.
ü™• The Toothbrush Squat
Brush your teeth? Do slow squats. The door is closed. Go nuts. Secret: 15-20 bodyweight squats.

All the Tips. Zero Judgment.

Browse by difficulty (Easy, Medium, Sneaky, or Legendary), or by body focus. Save your favorites. Get personalized recommendations based on your lifestyle. There‚Äôs even a category called ‚ÄúWatching TV‚Äù because we get you.

Look, we‚Äôre going to level with you: this section exists partly for SEO. Google loves long content. We love Google traffic. You love not paying for apps. Everyone wins.

But while we‚Äôre here stuffing keywords into this page like groceries into a reusable bag (that‚Äôs a workout, by the way ‚Äî tip #47), let‚Äôs talk about why Fitify is different from every other fitness app you‚Äôve downloaded, opened once, and then ignored for six months.

Why We‚Äôre Different (The Part Where We Sell You)

Other fitness apps want you to become a gym person. They want you to track macros, log reps, and feel bad about yourself until you eventually hit ‚Äúcancel subscription.‚Äù

Fitify doesn‚Äôt care if you ever set foot in a gym. We assume you won‚Äôt. We respect that. Our whole vibe is: you‚Äôre already doing stuff. Let‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ acknowledge it‚Äôs exercise and move on.

No guilt. No shame. No before/after photos. Just ‚Äúhey, you walked to the coffee machine 8 times today ‚Äî that‚Äôs like, 400 steps.‚Äù

It‚Äôs Free. For Now.

No subscriptions. No ‚Äúunlock premium to breathe correctly.‚Äù No ads. No crypto. (The AI suggested crypto. We said no. Twice.)

It won‚Äôt always be free ‚Äî we have to eat, presumably ‚Äî but get tips while you can! Because fitness guilt shouldn‚Äôt come with a price tag. The guilt should be free. Like Fitify. For now.

The Build

This was a solo build ‚Äî one developer plus AI agents who don‚Äôt sleep and occasionally suggest adding blockchain features. (‚ÄúWhat if users could mint their squats as NFTs?‚Äù No. Stop it.)

The entire thing was designed, built, and launched in a few weeks. Rails 8, because we‚Äôre not monsters. Turbo and Stimulus for the fancy bits. SQLite because we‚Äôre trying to keep hosting costs lower than your gym membership that you‚Äôre definitely still paying for.

It‚Äôs the kind of project that makes you wonder why more apps aren‚Äôt just‚Ä¶ simpler. Useful. And not trying to extract $9.99/month from your pocket while showing you unskippable ads for protein powder.

Try It

fitify.ca ‚Äî Go ahead. Your couch called. It said try one.
